Race.SpecificTitle: State Senator -- 24th Senatorial District
State Representative --  97th Representative District
City of Crowley -- 5 Mill - Mayor & BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Crowley Proposition
(Renewal of Five (5) Mill Fire & Police Personnel Salary Tax)

Summary: To authorize the City of Crowley to levy and collect a Five (5) Mill Tax
("Renewal") annually for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of Fire & Police
personnel salary.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Crowley, State of Louisiana, (the "City") under the provisions of Article
VI, Section 22, Section 27(B), Section 30(A) of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana
of 1974, continue to levy and collect a Five (5) Mill Tax on all property subject to
taxation situated within said City (current estimated annual amount of $325,967.00),
annually for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2010 and ending in
the year 2019, one-half (*) of the avails of which shall be for the purpose of and
dedicated to the payment of salaries of the personnel of the Fire Department of said
City and one-half (*) of the avails of which shall be for the purpose of and dedicated to
the payment of salaries of the personnel of the Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Kinder -- 10 Mills - Mayor & Town Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Kinder Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for general purposes.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Town of Kinder, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), pursuant to the provisions of
Article VI, Section 27(A) of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, be
authorized to continue to levy a millage for general purposes of ten (10) mills (the
estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one
entire year being $92,000) on all property subject to taxation within said Town for a
period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No.4 -- 4.9 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 4 Proposition

Summary: 10 year, 4.9 mills tax for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining and operating recreational facilities in the District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. 4 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District")
levy a tax of four and nine-tenths (4.9) mills (the estimated amount reasonably expected
to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $15,000) on all the
property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with
the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining and operating recreational facilities in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire District Number 8 -- $75 Service Charge - BOC - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire District Number Eight Proposition
(Service Charge)

Summary: Authority to levy a 10-year service charge of up to $75.00 per structure for
fire protection services.
Race.FullText:
Shall Caddo Parish Fire District Number Eight, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be
authorized to collect a service charge in an amount not to exceed $75.00 per annum for
each residential or commercial structure for a term not to exceed ten years,
commencing January 1, 2010 (an estimated $243,000 reasonably expected at this time
to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year), to be assessed on
persons owning each such structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or
partly within the boundaries of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Caddo Sewerage Dist. No.2 -- 16.98 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Caddo Sewerage District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary: Continuation of a 10 year, 16.98 mills property tax to provide funding for the
Caddo Sewerage District No. 2 of the Parish of Caddo, State of Louisiana.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Caddo Sewerage District No. 2 of the Parish of Caddo, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), continue to levy and collect a 16.98 mills tax on all the property subject to
taxation in said District (an estimated $120,000 reasonably expected at this time to be
collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years,
beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of paying
the maintenance and operating expenses of sewerage collection and disposal in said
Sewerage District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- Police Jury -- 5.99 Mill - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Library Tax Renewal)

Summary: Renewal of a 5.99 mill property tax beginning January 1, 2010 and ending
December 31, 2019 for the purposes of maintaining, constructing, equipping, operating,
and supporting the Calcasieu Parish Public Library System and its facilities.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Calcasieu Parish Police Jury, governing authority of Calcasieu Parish,
Louisiana, be authorized to renew, levy, and collect a special tax of five and ninetynine/
one-hundredths (5.99) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property
subject to taxation in the Parish of Calcasieu, for a period of ten (10) years from January
1, 2010 to December 31, 2019, for the purposes of maintaining, constructing, equipping,
operating, and supporting the Calcasieu Parish Public Library System and its facilities?
The estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for
one entire year is $7,895,022.

Race.SpecificTitle: GravityDrainDistNo.Three -- 7.50 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. Three Proposition

Summary: Authority for Gravity Drainage District No. Three to collect, for 10 years, a
tax of Seven and fifty hundredths (7.50) mills per annum on the dollar of assessed
valuation on all property subject to taxation in said District, (an estimated $268,708
reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per annum) for the purpose
of constructing, operating and maintaining said District's drainage operations within and
for said District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Gravity Drainage District No. Three of the Parish of Cameron, be authorized to
levy a tax of Seven and fifty hundredths (7.50) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation
on all property subject to taxation in said District, (an estimated $268,708 reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per annum) for a period of ten (10)
years, commencing with the year 2009, for the purpose of constructing, operating and
maintaining said District's drainage systems constituting works of public improvements,
title to which shall be in the public within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: GravityDrain.Dist.No.Four -- 3.68 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. Four Proposition

Summary: Authority for Gravity Drainage District No. Four to collect, for 10 years, a tax
of three and sixty-eight hundredths mills per annum on all property subject to taxation in
said District (an estimated $63,456 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of
this tax per annum) for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining drainage
operations within and for said District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Gravity Drainage District No. Four of the Parish of Cameron, be authorized to levy
a tax of three and sixty-eight hundredths (3.68) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation
on all property subject to taxation in said District, (an estimated $63,456 reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per annum) for a period of ten (10)
years, commencing with the year 2009, for the purpose of constructing, operating and
maintaining said District's drainage systems constituting works of public improvements,
title to which shall be in the public within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist.No.Seven -- 3.00 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. Seven Proposition

Summary: Authority for Recreation District No. Seven to collect, for 10 years, a tax of
three mills per annum on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated
$52,559 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per annum) for the
purpose of operating and maintaining said District's Recreation facilities within and for
said District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. Seven of the Parish of Cameron, be authorized to levy a
tax of three (3.00) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to
taxation in said District, (an estimated $52,559 reasonably expected to be collected
from the levy of this tax per annum) for a period of ten (10) years commencing with the
year 2009, for the purpose of operating and maintaining said District's Recreation
facilities within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. Nine -- 3.00 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. Nine Proposition

Summary: Authority for Recreation District No. Nine to collect, for 10 years, a tax of
three (3.00) mills per annum on all property subject to taxation in said District (an
estimated $101,707 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per
annum) for the purpose of operating and maintaining said District's recreation facilities
within and for said District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. Nine of the Parish of Cameron, be authorized to levy a tax
of three (3.00) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to
taxation in said District, (an estimated $101,707 reasonably expected to be collected
from the levy of this tax per annum) for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the
year 2009, for the purpose of operating and maintaining said District's recreation
facilities within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks Dist. No. Two -- 5.72 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Waterworks District No. Two Proposition

Summary: Authority for Waterworks District No. Two to collect, for 10 years, a tax of
five and seventy-two hundredths mills per annum on all property subject to taxation in
said District (an estimated $131,339 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy
of this tax per annum) for the purpose of operating and maintaining said District's water
systems within and for said District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Waterworks District No. Two of the Parish of Cameron, be authorized to levy a tax
of five and seventy-two hundredths (5.72) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on
all property subject to taxation in said District, (an estimated $131,339 reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of this tax per annum) for a period of ten (10)
years, commencing with the year 2009, for the purpose of operating and maintaining
said District's water systems within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. District No. 3 -- 10 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition

Summary: Renewal of a 10.00 mills property tax for the purpose of acquiring,
constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and
equipment for the District, including paying for the cost of obtaining water for fire
protection purposes.
Race.FullText:
Shall Claiborne Parish Police Jury, governing authority of Claiborne Parish, Louisiana,
be, authorized to renew, levy and collect a special tax of ten and no hundredths (10.00)
mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation in Fire
Protection District No. 3, for a period of ten (10) years January 1, 2010 to December 31,
2019, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or
operating fire protection facilities and equipment for Fire Protection District No. 3,
including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes? The estimated
amount reasonably expected to be collected for the levy of the tax for one entire year is
$169,630.

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 5 -- 10.37 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 5 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 10.37 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in
and for the Claiborne Parish Fire Protection District No. 5, including paying the
cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText:
Shall Claiborne Parish Fire Protection District No. 5, Louisiana (the "District"),
levy a ten and thirty-seven hundredths (10.37) mills tax on all the property
subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $176,000 reasonably expected at
this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of
ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019,
for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or
operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including
paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: School District No. 2 -- $7,000,000 Bonds - SB - not exceeding 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 2 Proposition

Summary: To authorize $7,000,000 of not exceeding 25-year general obligation school
bonds of School District No. 2 for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for
building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and
streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and
other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary
equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be
payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 2 of the Parish of DeSoto, State of Louisiana (the "District"),
incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Seven Million Dollars ($7,000,000), to run
not exceeding twenty-five (25) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not
exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and/or
improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary
sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school
buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the
necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which
bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem
taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the
Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental
thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central Comm. Sch. Bd. #1 -- Prop. #1 - 1/2% S&U - SB
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(1/2% Sales & Use Tax)

Summary: 1/2% sales and use tax beginning July 1, 2009 to be used first for a new
middle school, including, if necessary, land acquisition, and then for acquiring,
constructing and improving schools, including school related buildings, equipment and
facilities, subject to funding into bonds from time to time for capital improvements.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Central Community School Board, acting as the governing authority of the
Central Community School System (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a
tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax"), commencing July 1, 2009, upon the
sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or
consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services within the
geographic boundaries of the District, all as defined by law (an estimated $1,285,000
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire
year) with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs
and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used first
for constructing, furnishing and equipping a new middle school, including, if necessary,
land acquisition, and then for acquiring, constructing and improving schools, including
school related buildings, equipment and facilities; said Tax to be subject to funding into
bonds from time to time for capital improvements, in the manner provided by the laws of
Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central Comm. Sch. Bd. #2 -- Prop. #2-not exceed. $12,000,000- SB -20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(General Obligation Bonds)

Summary: Authority to issue not exceeding $12,000,000 of not exceeding 20 year
general obligation bonds for the purpose of renovating existing schools to address life
safety code issues, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad
valorem taxes.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Central Community School Board, acting as the governing authority of the
Central Community School System (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds not
exceeding Twelve Million Dollars ($12,000,000), in one or more series, to run not
exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding
seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of renovating existing schools to
address life safety code issues, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be
general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied
and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the
State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central Comm. Sch. Bd. #3 -- Prop. #3-not exceed. $20,000,000- SB -20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3
(General Obligation Bonds)

Summary: Authority to issue not exceeding $20,000,000 of not exceeding 20 year
general obligation bonds for the purpose of constructing, furnishing and equipping a
new elementary school, including, if necessary, land acquisition, and then for acquiring,
constructing and improving schools, including school related buildings, equipment and
facilities, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem
taxes.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Central Community School Board, acting as the governing authority of the
Central Community School System (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds not
exceeding Twenty Million Dollars ($20,000,000), in one or more series, to run not
exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding
seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing, furnishing and
equipping a new elementary school, including, if necessary, land acquisition, and then
for acquiring, constructing and improving schools, including school related buildings,
equipment and facilities, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general
obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and
collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the
State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW - Fire Prot. Dist. -- 6.25 Mills - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Fire Protection District)

Summary: 15 year, 6.25 mills property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining, operating and/or supporting facilities, equipment and vehicles to provide
fire protection and emergency services in Parishwide Fire Protection District of East
Feliciana Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall Parishwide Fire Protection District of the Parish of East Feliciana, State
of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of six and twenty-five hundredths
(6.25) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District for a period of
fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2023 (an
estimated $618,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the
tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining, operating and/or supporting facilities, equipment and vehicles to provide
fire protection and emergency services?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Ville Platte -- 15 Mills - Mayor & CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Ville Platte Proposition
(Millage)

Summary: Authority for the City of Ville Platte, Parish of Evangeline (the "City") to levy
a property tax for 20 years and 15 mills, proceeds of which will be used for acquiring,
constructing, renovating, improving, extending, maintaining and operating the City's
waterworks facilities.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Ville Platte, Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana (the "City"), be
authorized to levy and collect a special tax of 15 mills (the "Tax") on all property subject
to taxation in the City, annually for a period of twenty (20) years commencing with the
year 2009 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of constructing, renovating,
improving, extending, maintaining and operating the City's waterworks facilities, to the
extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including Part VI-B,
Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, and other authority, the
title to all facilities which shall be held in the public? (Estimated annual revenues:
$564,435).

Race.SpecificTitle: Vid.Grav.Drain.Dist.No.7 -- 3.74 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Vidrine Gravity Drainage District No. 7 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary: 10 years, 3.74 mills property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing,
maintaining and/or operating gravity drainage works within and for the District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Vidrine Gravity Drainage District No. 7 of the Parish of Evangeline, State of
Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a tax of three and seventyfour
hundredths (3.74) mills (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected
from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $12,522), on all the property subject
to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and
ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and/or
operating gravity drainage works within and for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Disrict No. 4 -- 15 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition

Summary: Authority to levy and collect a property tax of fifteen (15) mills for ten (10)
years beginning with 2009 for acquiring, constructing, improving, providing, maintaining
or operating fire protection facilities in the District with the estimated amount reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year being $580,000.
Race.FullText:
Shall Fire Protection District No. 4, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana be authorized
to levy and collect a tax of fifteen (15) mills on the dollar on all property subject to
taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning in the year 2009, with the
estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one
year being $580,000, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, providing,
maintaining or operating fire protection facilities within and for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Westwego -- 7 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Westwego Proposition

Summary: Authority to continue to levy and collect not exceeding 7 mills property tax
for 10 years, beginning in 2009 in the City of Westwego for maintaining and operating
the ambulance service for the City of Westwego; the estimated amount reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year is $351,463.07.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Westwego, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana be authorized to levy
and collect a tax not to exceed seven (7) mills on all property subject to taxation in said
City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2009, for the purpose of
maintaining and operating an Ambulance Service within said City, including the
acquisition of the necessary equipment and facilities therefor, titles to which shall be in
the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Police Jury -- 1/4% S&U - Police Jury
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(1/4% Sales Tax)

Summary: One-fourth of one percent (1/4%) (the "Tax") with the proceeds to be
dedicated and used for the purposes of constructing, improving, equipping, furnishing,
maintaining and operating a law enforcement center for the Parish of Jefferson Davis,
which shall include the construction of a new Parish Detention Center and
administrative offices for the Sheriff, with the proceeds of the tax to be subject to being
funded into bonds.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Jefferson Davis, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the
provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974,
and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of
one-fourth of one percent (1/4%) (the "Tax"), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease
or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal
property and on sales of services in the Parish, in the manner provided by State law,
with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of
collecting and administering the Tax) (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be
collected from the levy of the Tax for one entire year being $1,100,000), to be dedicated
and used for the purposes of constructing, improving, equipping, furnishing, maintaining
and operating a law enforcement center for the Parish, which shall include the
construction of a new Parish Detention Center and administrative offices for the Sheriff,
and shall the Parish be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds to
be issued from time to time for the aforesaid purposes, to the extent and in the manner
permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Cons.Sch.Dist.No.1(#1) -- Prop. #1 - 7.49 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 7.49 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining and operating school buildings in the District (including paying
the cost of operating and maintaining air-conditioning facilities) and the providing of
funds to cover the depreciation thereof.
Race.FullText:
Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana
(the "District"), levy a special tax of seven and forty-nine hundredths (7.49) mills on all
the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $4,528,000 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a
period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020 for
the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating school
buildings in the District (including paying the cost of operating and maintaining airconditioning
facilities) and the providing of funds to cover the depreciation thereof?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Cons.Sch.Dist.No.1(#2) -- Prop. #2 - 7.49 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 7.49 mills property tax renewal for giving additional support to
public schools in the District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of
Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of seven and forty-nine hundredths
(7.49) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated
$4,528,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of
the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year
2010 and ending with the year 2019 for the purpose of giving additional support to
public schools in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Cons.Sch.Dist.No.1(#3) -- Prop. #3 - 7.49 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 7.49 mills property tax renewal for providing funds for the payment
of salaries of teachers and all other employees of the District.
Race.FullText:
Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana
(the "District"), levy a special tax of seven and forty-nine hundredths (7.49) mills on all
the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $4,528,000 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a
period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019 for
the purpose of providing funds for the payment of salaries of teachers and all other
employees of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Law Enforcement District -- 1/2% S&U Tax - Sheriff
Race.SummaryText:
Law Enforcement District Proposition
(Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10-year 1/2% sales and use tax renewal for the Morehouse Parish Law
Enforcement District, for the purpose of providing additional funding for the Morehouse
Parish Sheriff's Office.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of Morehouse, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Constitution of the State
of Louisiana of 1974, R.S. 33:9003 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as
amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect,
and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, a tax of one-half of one
percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the
consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and
on sales of services in the District, all as presently defined in La. R.S. 47:301 through
La. R.S. 47:317, inclusive, for an additional period of ten (10) years, commencing
January 1, 2010, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and
necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated
and used for the purpose of providing additional funding for the District? (estimated
annual revenues: $1,440,000)

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Law Enforcement Dist. -- 6.24 Mills - Sheriff - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Law Enforcement District Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary: 20 year, 6.24 mills property tax continuation to provide funding for the
Plaquemines Parish Law Enforcement District.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), continue to levy and collect 6.24 mills tax on all the property subject to
taxation in said District (an estimated $4,936,000 reasonably expected at this time to be
collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of twenty (20) years,
beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of
providing continued funding for the District, said tax being a continuation of a tax
expiring in 2011?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#1) -- Prop. #1 - 2.49 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 2.49 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining or operating public hospital buildings for said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two and fortynine
hundredths (2.49) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish
(an estimated $1,978,800 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy
of the tax for an entire year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year
2010 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining or operating public hospital buildings for said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#2) -- Prop. #2 - 2 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 2 mills property tax renewal for constructing, operating and
maintaining pollution control and abatement facilities in said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two
(2) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated
$1,589,400 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for
an entire year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and
ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining
pollution control and abatement facilities in said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#3) -- Prop. #3 - 1 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3
(Rededication & Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 1 mill property tax rededication and renewal for constructing,
operating and maintaining solid waste (including landfill), and waste water disposal
facilities in said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax
on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $794,700
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire
year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with
the year 2024, for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining solid waste
(including landfill), and waste water disposal facilities in said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#4) -- Prop. #4 - 2.98 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 4
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 2.98 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing,
operating and maintaining waste disposal facilities, including garbage disposal in said
Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two and
ninety-eight hundredths (2.98) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the
Parish (an estimated $2,368,200 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from
the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with
the year 2010 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing,
operating and maintaining waste disposal facilities, including garbage disposal in said
Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#5) -- Prop. #5 - 1.51 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 5
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 1.51 mills property tax renewal for maintaining roads in said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one and fiftyone
hundredths (1.51) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish
(an estimated $1,199,990 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy
of the tax for an entire year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year
2010 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of maintaining roads in said
Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#6) -- Prop. #6 - 1 Mill - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 6
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 1 mill property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, operating
and maintaining public health units in said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax
on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $794,700
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire
year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with
the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, operating and maintaining
public health units in said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#7) -- Prop. #7 - 2 Mills - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 7
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 2 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining or operating waterworks in and for said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two (2) mills
tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $1,589,400
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire
year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with
the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or
operating waterworks in and for said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(Prop#8) -- Prop. #8 - 1 Mill - PC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 8
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 15 year, 1 mill property tax renewal for operating and maintaining the public
libraries of said Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax
on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $794,700
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire
year), for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with
the year 2024, for the purpose of operating and maintaining the public libraries of said
Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#1) -- Prop. #1 - 7.5 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 years, 7.5 mills property tax renewal for giving continuing support to the
public schools of the District, in particular for salaries and benefits for all teachers and
employees of the school system.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), levy a special tax of seven and five tenths (7.5) mills on all property subject to
taxation in the District (an estimated $5,960,000 reasonably expected at this time to be
collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years
beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of giving
continuing support to the public schools of the District, in particular for salaries and
benefits for all teachers and employees of the school system?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#2) -- Prop. #2 - 1 Mill - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 years, 1 mill property tax renewal for giving continuing support to the
public schools of the District, in particular for acquiring, improving and maintaining
technology throughout the school system.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), levy a special tax of one (1) mill on all property subject to taxation in the
District (an estimated $794,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from
the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the
year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of giving continuing support to
the public schools of the District, in particular for acquiring, improving and maintaining
technology throughout the school system?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#3) -- Prop. #3 - 1 Mill - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 years, 1 mill property tax renewal for giving continuing support to the
public schools of the District, in particular for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining and operating capital improvements throughout the school system including
air conditioning.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), levy a special tax of one (1) mill on all property subject to taxation in the
District (an estimated $794,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from
the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the
year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of giving continuing support to
the public schools of the District, in particular for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining and operating capital improvements throughout the school system including
air conditioning?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#4) -- Prop. #4 - 1.7 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 4
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 1.7 mills property tax renewal for giving continuing support to the
public schools of the District, for the payment of health benefits for teachers and
employees of the school system.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, levy a
special tax of one and seven tenths (1.7) mills on all the property subject to taxation in
said School District (an estimated $1,350,000 reasonably expected at this time to be
collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years,
beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of giving
continuing support to the public schools of the District, for the payment of health
benefits for teachers and employees of the school system?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#5) -- Prop. #5 - 2.4 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 5
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 2.4 mills property tax renewal for providing funds for the payment of
salaries of teachers and all other employees of said School District.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, continue to
levy a special tax of two and four tenths (2.4) mills on all of the property subject to
taxation in said School District (an estimated $1,907,000 reasonably expected at this
time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10)
years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023 for the purpose of
providing funds for the payment of salaries of teachers and all other employees of said
School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-School Dist. No.1 (#6) -- Prop. #6 - 4.78 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 6
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 4.78 mills property tax renewal for maintaining and operating
schools and school related facilities in said School District.
Race.FullText:
Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, continue to
levy a special tax of four and seventy-eight hundredths (4.78) mills on all the property
subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $3,798,000 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a
period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023 for
the purpose of maintaining and operating schools and school related facilities in said
School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW - School Board -- 11.96 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(School District)
(Millage)

Summary: Continuation of 10-year, 11.96 mill property tax for giving additional support
for the maintenance and operation of the public elementary and secondary schools.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Pointe Coupee Parish School District, State of Louisiana, be authorized to
continue to levy and collect a special tax of 11.96 mills on all property subject to taxation
in the Parish, annually for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2011
and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of giving additional support for the
maintenance and operation of the public elementary and secondary schools of the
Parish pursuant to Article VIII, Section 13(C) Third of the constitution of Louisiana of
1974? It is anticipated that the tax will generate $3,776,005 per year.

Race.SpecificTitle: Service Area #1 of FPD #2 -- 16.31 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Service Area No. 1 of Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: Authority to continue to levy a 10 year 16.31 mill property tax for acquiring,
constructing, improving, maintaining, and operating fire protection facilities and
equipment in Service Area No. 1 of Fire Protection District No. 2.
Race.FullText:
Shall Fire Protection District No. 2 of Rapides Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), continue
to levy and collect a special tax of sixteen and thirty-one hundredths (16.31) mills on all
the property subject to taxation within the confines of Service Area No. 1 of the District
for a period of ten years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020
(an estimated $330,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of
the tax for an entire year) for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, provided that no more
than the statutory limit provided by La. R.S. 40:1501 shall be used for the purpose of
acquiring fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 2 -- 17.65 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 17.65 mills property tax renewal for constructing, maintaining and
operating the District's fire protection facilities, including the furnishing of emergency
rescue equipment and services, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire
protection purposes.
Race.FullText:
Shall Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Landry, State of Louisiana
(the "District"), levy a special tax of seventeen and sixty-five hundredths (17.65)
mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $459,800
reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for
an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010, and ending
with the year 2019, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating the
District's fire protection facilities, including the furnishing of emergency rescue
equipment and services, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection
purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Water & Sewer Comm. No. 1 -- 5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Water and Sewer Commission No. 1 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year 5 mills property tax renewal for improving, extending, maintaining
and operating the sewers and sewage disposal works of the commission.
Race.FullText:
Shall St. Martin Parish Water and Sewer Commission No. 1, State of Louisiana (the
"Commission") continue to levy a five (5) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably
expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $96,430) on
all the property subject to taxation within the jurisdiction and territorial limits of the
Commission, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending
with the year 2019, for the purpose of improving, extending, maintaining and operating
the sewers and sewage disposal works of the Commission?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist.No.3 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in said District, and all
purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText:
Shall Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (the
"District") levy a special tax of ten (10) mills (the estimated amount reasonably expected
to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $458,890) on all the
property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with
the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, and all
purposes incidental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Consolidated GDD No.2 -- $6,320,000 Bond - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 Proposition

Summary: Authority to issue $6,320,000 of 20 year general obligation bonds for
constructing and improving the gravity and forced drainage works in the District and
acquiring the necessary lands, equipment and machinery therefor, with the bond
proceeds to be first used to construct levee improvements and enhancements that will
meet the FEMA and Corps of Engineers' required criteria for certification of levees for
flood and coastal surge protection, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText:
Shall Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of
Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Six Million Three
Hundred Twenty Thousand Dollars ($6,320,000) to run twenty (20) years from the date
thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the
purpose of constructing and improving the gravity and forced drainage works in the
District and acquiring the necessary lands, equipment and machinery therefor, with the
bond proceeds to be first used to construct levee improvements and enhancements that
will meet the FEMA and Corps of Engineers' required criteria for certification of levees
for flood and coastal surge protection, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds
will be general obligations of said District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to
be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the
Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental
thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No.2 -- 3 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 2 Proposition
(Millage)

Summary: 10 year, 3 mills property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational
facilities in Recreation District No. 2.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), levy a special tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation in the
District (an estimated $43,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the
levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year
2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing,
improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other
recreational facilities in said District, together with the necessary furnishings and
equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 6 -- 6 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 6 Proposition
(Millage)

Summary: 10 year, 6 mills property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving,
maintaining, operating and/or supporting parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and
other recreational facilities and programs in Recreation District No. 6.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. 6, St. Tammany Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), levy a
special tax of six (6) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated
$108,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an
entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with
the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining,
operating and/or supporting parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other
recreational facilities and programs in the District, together with the necessary
furnishings and equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Ponchatoula -- 10 Mills - Mayor and City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Ponchatoula Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for the City of Ponchatoula to be
allocated as follows: (i) 60% for paying police department salaries; (ii) 20% for paying
fire department salaries; and (iii) 20% for purchasing equipment for the police and fire
department.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Ponchatoula, State of Louisiana (the "City"), levy a tax of ten (10) mills
on all property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $320,000 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a
period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019,
with the revenues of said tax to be allocated as follows: (i) 60% for paying police
department salaries; (ii) 20% for paying fire department salaries; and (iii) 20% for
purchasing equipment for the police and fire departments of the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hammond Dwntwn Dev. Dist. -- 14.16 Mills -Hamm.Dwntwn.Develop.Auth.-5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Hammond Downtown Development District Proposition
(Millage Continuance)

Summary: 5-year 14.16-mill tax continuance for the Hammond Downtown Development
District, for constructing, renovating, acquiring, operating or maintaining facilities
contemplated by the District's redevelopment plan and for the operating expenses of the
District, including, without limitation, funding neighborhood grants for residential areas
east and west and providing matching funds for inducement of development in the
District.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Hammond Downtown Development District, State of Louisiana (the "District"),
continue to levy a tax of fourteen and sixteen hundredths (14.16) mills on all the
property subject to taxation within the District, (an estimated $168,000.00 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a
period of five (5) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2013,
inclusive, which tax will be subject to homestead exemption as provided by La. R.S.
33:2740, 15(E)(3), for the purpose of constructing, renovating, acquiring, operating or
maintaining facilities contemplated by the District's redevelopment plan and for the
operating expenses of the District, including, without limitation, funding neighborhood
grants for residential areas east and west and providing matching funds for inducement
of development in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 10 -- 11.45 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 10 Proposition
(Millage Continuation)

Summary: Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 11.45 mills property tax for acquiring,
constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreation facilities for Recreation
District No. 10 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana, including the purchase of
equipment therefor.
Race.FullText:
Shall Recreation District No. 10 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the
"District"), continue to levy an eleven and forty-five hundredths (11.45) mills tax on all
property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with
the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018 (an estimated $500,000 reasonably
expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the
purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating recreation facilities for the
District, including the purchase of equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- School Board -- 1/2% S&U Tax - SB
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(School Board Sales Tax)

Summary: Authority to levy and collect a 1/2% sales and use tax in the Parish of
Vermilion, with the proceeds to be dedicated and used solely for the purpose of
increasing the salaries and benefits of school employees.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana, under the
provisions of Section 2737.72 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as
amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and
collect a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") (the estimated amount
reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for one entire year being
$4,000,000), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and
the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of
services in the Parish of Vermilion, all in the manner provided by state law, with the
proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of
collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used solely for the purpose
of increasing the salaries and benefits of school employees?
